column7: Wanderlog List
column8: About

column7: #1 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in Eastern Cape"
column8: AboutGrazia Fine Food & Wine is a Mediterranean restaurant in East London with outdoor seating and parking available. The menu includes Italian dishes such as seafood and pasta, European favourites like shepherd's pie, and international favourites like buffalo chicken wrap. The restaurant also has a full bar serving wine and beer, and accepts American Express, Mastercard, and Visa.

column7: #4 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutLavender Blue Market, Café & Deli is a must-visit spot in the Eastern Cape, particularly if you're traveling on Route 72 between East London and Port Elizabeth. This family-friendly destination offers a delightful atmosphere with ample space for children to play while you enjoy delicious eats and drinks. The market features a variety of offerings including fresh produce, delectable sauces, sweets, and gifts. Additionally, there's a shop with beautiful clothes and more gifts to explore.

column7: #3 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutNestled in a serene environment, The Beach Break Cafe is a beloved spot for both locals and visitors seeking a delightful dining experience. Renowned for its exceptional coffee, light lunches, hearty breakfasts, and delectable cakes, this family-friendly cafe offers an array of healthy options like chicken wraps and scrumptious carrot cake. Guests can unwind under the trees while savoring their meals in a peaceful atmosphere that encourages relaxation.

column7: #1 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutNestled in the picturesque Cintsa East, just a short drive from East London, Emerald Vale Brewery is a charming family-owned establishment offering stunning views of the Eastern Cape's verdant landscapes. The brewery boasts a play area for children and serves up delectable pub-style dishes alongside their craft beers, all made with fresh rainwater. Whether you prefer Pale, Gold, Amber or Dark Ale, there's something to suit every beer enthusiast's palate.

column7: #2 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in Eastern Cape"
column8: AboutSanook Cafe is a restaurant located in Berea, East London. The cafe serves Italian, American, pizza and vegetarian friendly dishes. The cafe has outdoor seating and also offers table service.

column7: #7 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutOcean Basket East London is a popular seafood restaurant located in Port Elizabeth, Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern Cape, South Africa. It offers a cheerful atmosphere and serves a variety of seafood dishes and sharing platters. Visitors have enjoyed celebrating special occasions at the restaurant and noted that it caters to groups with diverse preferences. While some mentioned minor inconveniences like leaking roofs during rainy weather, the overall consensus is that Ocean Basket East London provides great food and an enjoyable dining experience.

column7: #11 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutCafé Neo is a charming eatery that stands out for its diverse menu and inviting ambiance, making it an ideal spot for casual dining and intimate gatherings. With a delightful selection of dishes ranging from Mediterranean-inspired breakfasts to hearty lunches and dinners, this café caters to all tastes. Guests rave about the top-notch cocktails crafted from premium ingredients, alongside mouthwatering options like pasta, burgers, oxtail with veggies, and seafood delights. The attentive staff ensures a warm welcome and excellent service throughout your visit.

column7: #10 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutNestled in The Crossing of Beacon Bay, Cantina & Craft is a vibrant Mexican-themed restaurant that promises an unforgettable dining experience for the whole family. With a delightful kids' menu featuring fun options like Corn on the Cob, Cheesy Nachos with Chicken, and Mini Burritos with Mac and Cheese, even picky eaters will find something to enjoy. The stylish yet relaxed ambiance creates a welcoming atmosphere complemented by friendly service.

column7: #6 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutThe Cow and Milk Shed is a cozy eatery that offers reinvented comfort food in a pleasant atmosphere. The menu features dishes like Wiltshire pork sausage on mash with onion gravy and creamy salmon-and-pea risotto, all beautifully presented. However, the highlight is their dry-aged steaks served with flavorful sauces. Whether you choose to dine at the bar or restaurant side, you can expect generous serving sizes and attentive service.

column7: #9 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutNestled in the heart of East London, Jules on Jarvis is a delightful bistro and coffee shop that emphasizes fresh, local ingredients to create honest and delectable meals. With an inviting atmosphere perfect for enjoying breakfast, lunch, or dinner, this charming spot features a menu that includes gourmet pizzas and tempting homemade treats. The culinary expertise of two Cordon-bleu chefs ensures every dish is crafted with care.

column7: #12 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutThe Grillroom is an upscale beachfront steakhouse offering a diverse range of reasonably priced, high-quality meals. Its extensive wine and beverage selection perfectly complements the menu. The interior is stunningly beautiful, immaculately clean, and boasts friendly service. The steaks are of exceptional quality and are presented with exquisite taste. The atmosphere is warm, cozy, making it suitable for intimate dinners or year-end team functions.

column7: #5 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in Eastern Cape"
column8: AboutNestled away from the hustle and bustle of city life, Sanook Eatery is a delightful addition to East London's dining scene. This charming venue offers a warm and cozy atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for families with older children or anyone looking to enjoy a meal in comfort. The menu boasts an impressive array of options, from mouthwatering pizzas and gourmet burgers to more refined dishes like dukkah-crusted fillet and biltong-spiced sirloin steak.

column7: #14 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutThe Cricketer, located approximately 17 kilometers outside of East London, is a beloved dining spot known for its top-notch steaks and warm atmosphere. The restaurant exudes a cozy and rustic charm, offering a homely yet elegant setting for patrons to enjoy quality food and attentive service. Visitors praise the delicious steaks, particularly the rump steak, as well as other menu items like Springbok carpaccio. Guests also appreciate the affordable breakfast options and friendly staff.

column7: #21 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutThe Reef Café, located in a beautiful and peaceful setting, offers more than just delicious food and a welcoming atmosphere. Visitors can take advantage of a special offer that includes a free coffee for those who use provided plastic bags to pick up garbage on the beaches. The manager is known for being hands-on, ensuring high standards in both food and service. Additionally, the café's location provides access to scenic walks through nature reserves with stunning views of sand dunes and the sea.

column7: #20 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutThe Silver Eagle Spur Steak Ranch is a family-friendly restaurant with excellent service, that dishes up steaks, burgers, ribs and wings. It's a great place to go for a meal or takeout, and they accept American Express, Mastercard and Visa. Free wifi is available as well as delivery.

column7: #18 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutGinger & Co is a well-established fine-dining restaurant located in Gqeberha's Beach Hotel, offering stylish dining with sea views. The menu features contemporary dishes with local flair, including an impressive selection of seafood, steaks, and game meats. The restaurant prides itself on serving meals made with love and passion, providing diners with a memorable culinary experience.

column7: #23 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutJohn Dory's Hemingways Mall offers a delightful dining experience with a variety of menu options to choose from. Guests can enjoy a romantic dinner with excellent food and hospitable hosts. The Maritime platter special is highly recommended, along with the delicious sushi and refreshing Pina colada. The attentive service adds to the overall enjoyable visit at this restaurant.

column7: #31 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutWhen an elderly man had a vision and ran out of time, someone stepped up to fulfill his dream. Having worked as a chef for 45 years, IRANA Gooranah dedicated himself to the culinary industry, honing his skills day after day. Nestled in a small corner, Irana Indian Restaurant offers delectable Indian cuisine with a touch of elegance.

column7: #33 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutThe Windmill Roadhouse is a restaurant with a wide menu that includes breakfast, lunch and dinner. The food was good, and the milkshakes were popular. There is a lot of parking available, and service was excellent. The atmosphere was even better.

column7: #38 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutMugg & Bean is a modern chain cafe known for its hearty classics, gourmet burgers, sandwiches, and giant muffins. The restaurant offers a variety of breakfast and brunch options such as Omelettes, Eggs Benedict choices including unique options like Buffalo Chicken & Blue Cheese Eggs Benedict. With locations at Vincent Park Shopping Centre, Hemingways Mall, and East London Airport, Mugg & Bean provides a relaxed and cozy atmosphere suitable for family dinners, business lunches or catching up with friends.

column7: #35 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutShanghai Chinese Restaurant & Sushi Bar has two locations in Beacon Bay and Quigney, offering delicious Cantonese cuisine and sushi at great value. The restaurant is known for its authentic Shanghai dishes like brinjal fritters, sizzling lamb, and chicken with cashew nuts. Special occasions can be celebrated with a pre-ordered Peking duck with plum sauce. The atmosphere may feel a bit cold, but the friendly and helpful waitstaff make up for it.

column7: #34 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutHeavenly Pancake House in Gonubie is a charming beachfront venue that specializes in savory and sweet pancakes. The restaurant offers fresh, high-quality dishes with friendly and attentive staff. Guests can enjoy the stunning ocean views while sipping on cappuccinos and indulging in delicious pancakes. Although parking may be limited, the overall experience of dining at this establishment is delightful, with many visitors praising the excellent service and breathtaking sea view.

column7: #37 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutTable 58 Brewing is a charming craft brewery located within the beautiful gardens of the Floradale Garden Centre in Beacon Bay. It has become a popular spot for both locals and tourists, offering an array of craft beers, a value-for-money menu, and a spacious outdoor deck with local entertainment. The atmosphere is welcoming and vibrant, with special offers like buy-one-get-one-free burgers on Tuesdays. The large beer garden creates an outdoor feel while maintaining comfort among the trees.

column7: #32 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutWimpy is a well-established casual dining spot known for its selection of burgers, mixed grills, and other classic comfort dishes. Situated by the ocean, it offers a serene atmosphere with a refreshing sea breeze. Visitors have praised the friendly staff who go out of their way to assist guests, such as providing access to WiFi for booking transportation. The eatery is lauded for its great service and delicious food, making it an ideal spot for a satisfying breakfast or a filling meal.

column7: #40 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutPanarottis Hemingways is an Italian restaurant located at Hemingways. It offers a wide variety of delicious pizza and pasta made from high-quality ingredients. The restaurant provides a family-friendly environment with an awesome kiddies area where kids can build their own pizzas and decorate their own waffles. The service is known for being friendly and accommodating, making every visitor feel comfortable.

column7: #43 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutThe new location of La Cuisinette is smaller, but it offers a more intimate atmosphere. They were the only ones booked on that particular night, which allowed for excellent service. The food was exquisite, ranging from delicious steak to flavorful tongue. It would have been nice if they had something special for the birthday girl in our group, as this could potentially attract more people to celebrate their birthdays at the restaurant.

column7: #27 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutNestled along Old Transkei Road in Nahoon, Ciao Bella Cafe & Pizzeria is a delightful haven for lovers of authentic Italian cuisine. This charming spot specializes in mouthwatering pizzas, delectable pasta dishes, and scrumptious paninis that are sure to satisfy any craving. Open throughout the week with varying hours, it’s an ideal place for breakfast or a cozy dinner. During my recent visit while passing through town, I stumbled upon this little gem after a quick online search.

column7: #48 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutBrazas Portuguese Fusion in East London is making a mark with its unique and vibrant flair, embodying the motto "Mi Casa Su Casa" to create a welcoming and homely atmosphere. The restaurant boasts a cozy ambiance with personalized decor and soft lighting, setting the stage for an exceptional dining experience. Blending traditional Portuguese flavors with innovative twists, Brazas offers a delightful and unforgettable culinary journey.

column7: #45 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutAreena Quays Restaurant is a family-friendly dining spot with a tranquil environment and plenty of activities for kids. The restaurant offers delicious food and fantastic service, making it an ideal place for a special celebration or a relaxing meal. With its stunning views and serene ambience, Areena Quays Restaurant is the perfect destination for those looking to enjoy an "All you can eat" experience while surrounded by nature.

column7: #36 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutJade Garden Fusion Restaurant is a top-rated spot in East London, offering a pleasant and beautiful setting with comfortable seating. The restaurant is known for its marvelous food, and the staff provides great service, making it a rare find in the area. Visitors praise the cleanliness, newness, and appealing decor of the restaurant. The menu features a variety of Chinese dishes that have impressed even those who were previously not fans of certain flavors. Customers can enjoy dine-in or take advantage of the convenient takeaway service.

column7: #28 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutKey Largo, located at Hemingways Hotel, offers a diverse selection of dishes from the grill buffet and a la carte menu. The restaurant boasts stunning views of the beautiful gardens and is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Guests have praised the exquisite food and excellent service, making it an unforgettable dining experience. The buffet on Friday nights is particularly popular for its delicious offerings. Chef Shaun Gibb's culinary skills have been highlighted as exceptional, adding to the restaurant's appeal.

column7: #47 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutElahleni Food and Braai offers a variety of experiences to its customers. From enjoying their reasonably priced braai meat as a takeaway lunch option, to hosting intimate birthday dinners in their VIP room, they strive to create memorable moments for their patrons. The restaurant's decor team beautifully sets up the VIP room, allowing diners to enjoy a private ambiance while still faintly hearing the lively atmosphere of other guests. The food is known to be delicious and the staff is attentive and helpful.

column7: #50 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutMcDonald's Oxford Road Drive-Thru is a renowned, time-honored fast-food franchise recognized for its delectable hamburgers and crispy fries. With an extensive history of operation, this iconic establishment has built a solid reputation among diners worldwide. Its menu showcases an array of savory options, including succulent beef patties nestled between soft buns, accompanied by perfectly seasoned deep-fried potato sticks.

column7: #25 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutQuarry Lake Inn is a laid-back guesthouse in East London, offering unfussy rooms with beautiful views of the former quarry and the surrounding greenery. The establishment provides an outdoor pool, sundeck, and gym for a tranquil stay. Guests have praised the helpful and caring staff, scrupulously clean rooms with clever design for unexpected but beautiful views. The inn is perfectly situated within trees and by a lake, providing spacious well-decorated clean rooms with ensuite bathrooms.

column7: #30 on"Where to eat: the 50 best restaurants in East London"
column8: AboutLocated in East London, Blue Sea Guest House is the perfect choice for families seeking a relaxing and enjoyable stay. The friendly host provides a comprehensive tour of all the facilities upon arrival. The rooms are comfortable and equipped with everything you need. A delectable breakfast, prepared by the hostess herself, can be enjoyed by guests. Safety is ensured with electric gates to protect vehicles, and there is also a pool and expansive lawn for children to play on.

column7: N/A
column8: AboutRocoMamas Beacon Bay Crossing is a great hamburger restaurant in East London. The food was amazing and the service was excellent. Unfortunately, the waiter wasn't visible at our table, but overall it was a good experience.
